dt-example.title: Row selection - single row select
dt-example.info:
As well as providing a button toolbar, TableTools provides everything needed to have selectable rows in the table. TableTools has four row selection modes of operation:
* `none` - Default, where no user row selection options are available * `single` - A single row can be selected * `multi` - Multiple rows can be selected simply by clicking on the rows * `os` - Operating System like selection where you can use the shift and ctrl / cmd keys on your keyboard to add / remove rows from the selection.
This example shows the `single` select option.
